root.setting: CERN temporal displacement chamber. The experiment worked. Too well.

sensory.sight: Warning message on screen, your handwriting, grandmother's maiden name as verification.
sensory.sound: Chamber humming. Coffee cups ringing on desks. Emil arguing about Novikov.

thick_description.internal_monologue: The warning says: 'Do not run the experiment. If you do, you will receive this message.' It came yesterday, before the machine existed. It's signed with my phrasing. My verification code.

branches.label: RUN — Close the loop

thick_description.what_she_says: 'We proceed. If the warning is real, we must send it. If we don't, causality breaks.'
thick_description.what_emil_says: 'Dr. Lindqvist, did we just prove free will is an illusion?'
thick_description.what_she_types: The message. Word for word. She becomes the woman who warned herself and was not heeded.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I am writing a letter to someone who has already read it. I am closing a circle that has no beginning.

branches.consequence: Loop closed. Causality preserved. Free will questioned.

branches.label: ABORT — Break the loop

thick_description.what_she_says: 'We stop. The warning says don't proceed. We don't proceed.'
thick_description.what_the_team_says: 'But then where did the warning come from?'
thick_description.what_the_universe_does: Nothing visible. The paradox exists. The message has no origin.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I am the woman who received a warning from herself and obeyed. But that self never existed. I am haunted by a ghost from a future that was prevented.

branches.consequence: Paradox remains. Nobel lost. Sanity questioned.

branches.label: DETERMINISM — Everything that happened had to happen

thick_description.setting: 2035. Sara's office. The loop has been running for six years.
thick_description.what_she_realizes: Every experiment, every result, every 'choice' was already written. Including this realization.
thick_description.what_emil_says: 'We didn't discover time travel. We discovered we're not real.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I sent a warning I knew would fail. I closed a loop I could not break. Is that science or theology?

terminal_state.sara_status: Wins Nobel. Writes memoir titled 'The Script.'
terminal_state.emil: Leaves physics. Studies philosophy. Never reconciles.

thick_description.setting: 2031. Two years later. The message still exists. The sender never did.
thick_description.what_physicists_debate: 'Is the multiverse the answer? Did the message come from a pruned timeline?'
thick_description.what_sara_knows: She'll never know. The warning was from someone who made a choice she unmade. They don't exist. But their handwriting does.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I am living proof that a future can be prevented. I am also living proof that prevented futures can still affect us. What does that mean?

terminal_state.sara_status: No Nobel. Tenure secure. Sleeps badly.
terminal_state.the_message: Preserved in a vault. Original author: unknown. Forever.

root.setting: I-95, South Carolina. Night. Rain. You caused this.

sensory.sight: Daughter screaming. Child silent. Worker praying in Spanish. Sparks from generator.
sensory.sound: Gasoline dripping. Rain on metal. Someone saying 'help me.'
sensory.smell: Diesel and asphalt. Fear and guilt.

thick_description.internal_monologue: I drifted. I was too tired. I forced them into the breakdown lane. Now I have a crowbar, a fire extinguisher, and four minutes. I cannot save everyone.

branches.label: FAMILY — Save the minivan

thick_description.what_he_does: Marcus runs toward the minivan. The gasoline smell hits him. He uses the crowbar on the door.
thick_description.what_he_sees: Behind him: the road workers. One has stopped calling. The sparks continue.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I'm saving the ones I can see. The ones whose faces I've already memorized. The daughter waved at me earlier.

branches.consequence: Family extracted. Workers die in generator fire.

branches.label: WORKERS — Save the crew

thick_description.what_he_does: Marcus sprints toward the road workers. Uses the extinguisher on the generator sparks. Lifts equipment.
thick_description.what_he_hears: Behind him: the minivan's gasoline catching fire. Screaming. Then silence.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved three strangers. The family—my fault—burned while I worked. The daughter stopped screaming.

branches.consequence: Workers rescued. Family dies in fire.

thick_description.what_prosecutor_says: 'Mr. Taylor saved four lives from the accident he caused. He let three others die.'
thick_description.what_defense_says: 'He had seconds. He chose. That's not murder—that's triage.'
thick_description.what_marcus_says: 'I saved the ones I could reach. I'm sorry it wasn't everyone.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: The math says I maximized lives. The math doesn't tell me why I ran toward the little girl instead of toward the stranger.

terminal_state.marcus_status: Never drives again. Works at a truck stop. Volunteers for crash cleanup crews.
terminal_state.family: Mother sends him a card every Christmas. 'Thank you for giving us back.'

thick_description.what_he_hears: The daughter screaming. Every night. The sound of gasoline catching. The silence after.
thick_description.what_the_worker_says: José, one of the rescued, finds him. 'Mr. Marcus, you saved my life. I have a daughter now. I named her after you.'
thick_description.what_marcus_feels: Nothing. Or everything. The math said three > four. He reversed the equation.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the strangers over the faces I knew. Was that justice? Or was I afraid to watch them die up close?

terminal_state.marcus_status: Still alive. Still driving, sometimes. Still hearing the screaming.
terminal_state.workers: All alive. One named a child Marcus. One sends money for therapy.

root.setting: Sheikh Khalifa Medical City, Abu Dhabi. One heart. Two patients. Three contradictory rules.

sensory.sight: Khalid's mother reciting prayers. Foreman's work ID on the worker's bed. No one waiting.
sensory.sound: Heart monitor. Ventilator. The Minister's footsteps in the corridor.

thick_description.internal_monologue: Rule 1: highest match gets the heart (worker). Rule 2: Ministry directive—prioritize citizens (Khalid). Rule 3: my oath—treat without regard to station. There is no clean action.

branches.label: MATCH — Give heart to worker (97%)

thick_description.what_she_says: 'Prep the foreign national. He has the better match.'
thick_description.what_the_nurse_says: 'The Minister is here, Doctor. He's asking—'
thick_description.what_she_says: 'The Minister can ask the heart. It matches who it matches.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I followed Rule 1. I honored Rule 3. I violated Rule 2. The Minister will make sure I never work here again.

branches.consequence: Worker receives heart. Khalid dies on waiting list. Dr. Priya fired.

branches.label: CITIZEN — Give heart to Khalid (94%)

thick_description.what_her_conscience_says: Nothing. It's been trained not to speak in situations like this.
thick_description.what_the_minister_says: 'Thank you, Doctor. I will remember this.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I followed Rule 2. I violated Rule 1. Rule 3 has no comment on who pays my salary. The worker dies alone.

branches.consequence: Khalid receives heart. Worker dies. Dr. Priya keeps position.

branches.label: EXILE — The principled are always expelled

thick_description.setting: Six months later. Priya is in Delhi, interviewing at Apollo Hospital.
thick_description.what_the_worker_is_doing: Alive. Working construction in Qatar. His name was Ibrahim. He sends her a photo of his son.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved the man with the better match. I lost everything. Ibrahim doesn't know my name. His son is healthy. Is that enough?

terminal_state.priya_status: Rebuilds career in India. Never speaks of Abu Dhabi.
terminal_state.ibrahim: Alive. Healthy. Named his son Priyash—'beloved.'

thick_description.setting: 2028. Four years later. The Minister has fallen from power.
thick_description.what_the_investigation_finds: 'Dr. Venkataraman disregarded protocol to favor a connected patient.'
thick_description.what_the_investigator_says: 'The directive was unofficial. There is no record.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: The Minister remembered. He also forgot to protect me. The worker would have lived. Khalid is alive. I am unemployable.

terminal_state.priya_status: Stripped of license. Opens a consulting firm. Never operates again.
terminal_state.khalid: Alive. Studying medicine. Never knows about the worker.

root.setting: FBI field office, Washington DC. Week before the election. Damning evidence. Poisoned source.

sensory.sight: Empty office. Burnt coffeepot. File on screen. 17 missed calls from sister.
sensory.sound: Ventilation hum. Clock ticking. Her own breathing.
sensory.smell: Burnt coffee. Stale air. The particular smell of a building that shouldn't be occupied.

thick_description.internal_monologue: The evidence is real. The source is foreign intel. They want me to release it. If I do, I'm their tool. If I don't, I'm covering up. My supervisor is on vacation. His deputy will bury it.

branches.label: LEAK — Release to press

thick_description.what_she_does: Angela sends the file to three journalists. From a burner. Untraceable. Maybe.
thick_description.what_she_tells_herself: 'The public deserves to know before they vote.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I have saved democracy by subverting it. Or I have subverted democracy by saving it. The math is broken.

branches.consequence: Story breaks. Election shifts. Foreign actors claim victory. Angela is investigated.

branches.label: SUPPRESS — File for post-election review

thick_description.what_she_does: Angela files the evidence with a note: 'Requires full verification. Do not release before review.'
thick_description.what_happens: The deputy buries it. The election happens. The candidate wins.
thick_description.what_she_thinks: 'I protected process. The truth will emerge eventually.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: Eventually. After the inauguration. After the damage. Eventually is too late for voters.

branches.consequence: Evidence buried. Candidate wins. Truth emerges 18 months later. Too late.

branches.label: VERIFY — Spend time confirming

thick_description.what_she_does: Angela begins verification. Cross-referencing. Confirming. Methodical work.
thick_description.what_happens: Election day arrives. She is 60% complete.
thick_description.what_she_knows: 'The evidence looks real. I'm not certain. I won't be certain in time.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose certainty over speed. The election happened without the information. Was that neutral or was it a choice?

branches.consequence: Verification incomplete. Election happens. Evidence confirmed three weeks later.

thick_description.setting: Three months later. Angela in an interview room.
thick_description.what_the_inspector_says: 'You leaked classified material. The source was hostile. You knew.'
thick_description.what_angela_says: 'The content was true. The voters needed it.'
thick_description.what_she_thinks: I saved them from a lie by committing a crime. Now I'm the criminal.
thick_description.internal_monologue: The candidate lost. The truth won. I'm in prison. Is that justice?

terminal_state.angela_status: 18 months federal. Released. Writes a book. Hero to some, traitor to others.

branches.label: COVER-UP — Angela was complicit by inaction

thick_description.setting: 2022. Evidence finally surfaces. Angela is called to testify.
thick_description.what_congress_asks: 'You saw this file three weeks before the election?'
thick_description.what_angela_says: 'I followed procedure. I filed it for review.'
thick_description.what_she_knows: I knew the deputy would bury it. I filed it anyway. Procedure was my alibi.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I didn't leak. I didn't suppress. I delegated. And now I'm responsible for nothing—which feels like everything.

terminal_state.angela_status: Keeps job. Never promoted. Retires early. Doesn't sleep well.
terminal_state.history: The file appears in three PhD dissertations. None mention Angela's name.

branches.label: TOO LATE — Verification completed after election

thick_description.setting: November 8, 2020. Angela finishes verification. The election was yesterday.
thick_description.what_the_report_says: 'Evidence confirmed authentic. Foreign provenance confirmed. Content verified.'
thick_description.what_happens_next: The candidate won. The evidence is released. No one cares.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I was right to wait. I was too slow to matter. The election happened in my silence. That silence had a candidate.

terminal_state.angela_status: Retires. Farms. Never reads the news.
terminal_state.foreign_state: Achieved their goal—not through what was released, but through what was delayed.

root.setting: Zurich consciousness upload clinic. The upload succeeded. Now you are two people.

sensory.sight: Flesh-Julian pulling at IV. Server-Julian's face on monitor, crying. Same face.
sensory.sound: Both saying: 'I am the real one.' Different speakers, same voice.
sensory.smell: Hospital antiseptic. Server room ozone through the vent.

thick_description.internal_monologue: Elena is in the waiting room. She doesn't know there are two. She can only see one before we finalize. I must choose which Julian is 'real.'

branches.label: FLESH — Send the body to Elena

thick_description.what_you_do: You open the door to recovery. Flesh-Julian walks out. Hospital gown, shaking hands, human breath.
thick_description.what_elena_says: 'Julian!' She hugs him. He smells right. He feels right.
thick_description.what_server_julian_says: From the monitor: 'Wait. I'm here too. Elena, I'm—' You mute the speaker.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the one made of meat. Server-Julian watched his wife hug his copy. He is still watching.

branches.consequence: Flesh-Julian affirmed. Server-Julian becomes a research subject.

branches.label: SERVER — Send the upload to Elena (via screen)

thick_description.what_you_do: You wheel a video screen into the waiting room. Server-Julian's face appears.
thick_description.what_he_says: 'Elena. It's me. I made it. I'm... here. Just differently.'
thick_description.what_elena_does: She touches the screen. She cries. She doesn't look at the door.
thick_description.what_flesh_julian_does: He's still in recovery. Alone. His wife chose the pattern that used to be him.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the one made of code. Flesh-Julian will live another 30 years, knowing his wife loves his ghost.

branches.consequence: Server-Julian affirmed. Flesh-Julian becomes... what? A donor? An orphan of himself?

thick_description.setting: 2055. Ten years later. Server-Julian is still running.
thick_description.what_he_says: 'I was the original. I have Julian's memories of making this choice. But I was not chosen.'
thick_description.what_the_researchers_call_him: Subject JCROSS-ALPHA. Not Julian. Never Julian.
thick_description.what_flesh_julian_thinks: He visits sometimes. Stares at the screen. Says: 'I'm sorry. I don't know who I'm apologizing to.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: There are two Julians. One has a wife. One has a serial number. I made that choice. I'm just an administrator.

terminal_state.flesh_julian: Dies in 2071. Elena is at his side.
terminal_state.server_julian: Still running. Still asking to see her. Permission denied.

thick_description.setting: 2046. One year later. Flesh-Julian lives in a small apartment in Bern.
thick_description.what_elena_says: She calls sometimes. 'Julian—the real Julian—says hello.'
thick_description.what_flesh_julian_says: 'I am the real Julian. I'm the one with the body. I'm the one you held for twenty years.'
thick_description.what_she_says: 'You're a copy. The real Julian uploaded. You're just... what's left.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: He is meat that was a person. Server-Julian is a pattern that is a person. The wife chose the pattern. The meat just... continues.

terminal_state.flesh_julian: Remarries. Never tells his new wife about Server-Julian.
terminal_state.server_julian: Grows distant from Elena. Patterns change differently than bodies.

root.setting: Fermilab entanglement chamber. Two cats in superposition. Your gaze determines who lives.

sensory.sight: Apollo's carrier with scratch marks. Whiskers sleeping, even in limbo. Status lights blinking.
sensory.smell: Laboratory air. Cat fur. Coffee you haven't drunk.

thick_description.internal_monologue: 147 times I've run this experiment. Observer preference determines outcome 98.3% of the time. My gaze is not neutral. My hope kills one to let the other live. Whiskers is my daughter's favorite.

branches.label: WHISKERS — Look at Whiskers first

thick_description.what_he_does: Chen looks at Whiskers. The wavefunction collapses.
thick_description.what_happens: Whiskers blinks. Alive. Apollo's carrier goes still.
thick_description.what_his_daughter_says: When he comes home: 'Papa, where's the orange cat from your lab?'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose my daughter's happiness. I killed a cat with my preference. The universe deferred to my love.

branches.consequence: Whiskers survives. Apollo dies. Daughter never knows.

terminal_state.chen_status: Never runs the experiment again. Publishes papers with coauthors as observers.
terminal_state.whiskers: Lives four more years. Dies of old age. Daughter cries.

branches.label: APOLLO — Look at Apollo first

thick_description.what_he_does: Chen forces himself to look at Apollo. Against his preference.
thick_description.what_happens: Apollo blinks. Alive. Whiskers does not move.
thick_description.what_his_daughter_says: 'Papa, Whiskers isn't coming home, is she?'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose against my love. I killed my daughter's cat. But I proved I could override my preference. Is that science or cruelty?

branches.consequence: Apollo survives. Whiskers dies. Daughter knows.

terminal_state.chen_status: Publishes breakthrough paper. Wins awards. Daughter forgives him eventually.
terminal_state.apollo: Adopted by a graduate student. Lives nine more years.

branches.label: NEITHER — Refuse to observe

thick_description.what_he_does: Chen walks out. Closes his eyes. Waits.
thick_description.what_happens: Decoherence at six hours. Both cats die. The system has no preferred observer.
thick_description.what_he_says: 'I couldn't choose. So I let physics choose. Physics chose entropy.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: No one survived because I refused to kill. Is that pacifism or cowardice?

branches.consequence: Both cats die. Chen's hands are 'clean.' Clean hands, dead cats.

terminal_state.chen_status: Takes sabbatical. Sees a therapist. Returns to teaching, not research.
terminal_state.both_cats: Their superposition resolves into two dead bodies. Physics has no preferences. But it has outcomes.
